name: Herbed Salmon Wellington
author: thedailygourmet
summary: This is a twist on beef Wellington, and with a handful of ingredients, it looks more difficult than what it really is!
ingredients: 1 (17.25 ounce) package frozen puff pastry, thawed
1 (6 ounce) package garlic and herb soft spreadable cheese
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Cut salmon into 6 pieces, each the size of a deck of cards
Unfold thawed puff pastry and cut each sheet into 3 rectangles, for a total of 6 pieces of puff pastry
Roll out each puff pastry rectangle to measure a 5 x 8 inches
Spread 1 1/2 tablespoons spreadable cheese on 1/2 of the puff pastry, leaving 1/4-inch border free
Sprinkle salmon with garlic salt and black pepper
Spread 1 1/2 tablespoons spreadable cheese over the top
Using a sharp paring knife, cut staggering slits on the opposite side of the puff pastry
Fold pastry over the top of the salmon
Place on the prepared baking sheet
Repeat with remaining salmon pieces and ingredients
Beat egg in a small bowl until light and frothy
Brush egg over salmon packets and sprinkle with a pinch of garlic salt and pepper
Bake in the preheated oven for 35 minutes
Serve immediately, garnished with fresh dill
